title: Mark Carney says fiscal discipline 'imperative' to combat global inflation, instability
description: Mark Carney says it's time to use prudent fiscal policy, reduce deficits to fight global financial challenges. Read on.

title: Mark Carney Declares New Budget Plan While Shading Trump Government
description: While announcing his new budget plan on Wednesday, Mark Carney subtly threw shade at Donald Trump's U.S, government.

title: Business Brief: The crisis behind the budget

title: 'This is not a game,' Carney says as he signals he's ready to fight election over federal budget
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney signalled at the close of the APEC summit that he'd be prepared to fight an election over the upcoming federal budget — remarks that set the stage for a parliamentary showdown over the fiscal plan,

title: Champagne promises a ‘generational’ budget — optimistic opposition parties will see reason to support
description: On the eve of presenting his first budget, Finance Minister François-Philippe Champagne suggested the hotly anticipated document will have something for every Canadian — even the opposition parties.

title: What a swelling federal deficit could mean for Canada's AAA credit rating
description: Canada's federal deficit could go as high as $100 billion this fiscal year. Here's what that means for its AAA credit rating. Find out more.

title: How soaring government debt could play a starring role in the next great financial crisis
description: With US$37 trillion in debt and a rising deficit, the next great financial calamity could be. But The U.S. is not alone.

title: Ottawa is seeking a permanent parliamentary budget officer with ‘tact and discretion’
description: OTTAWA — Ottawa says it’s looking to hire a permanent parliamentary budget officer — someone with “tact and discretion” _ just a few months after appointing a highly critical fiscal watchdog on an interim basis. The federal government’s list of governor-in-co…

title: Bank of Canada Mulled Delaying Cut Until After Carney’s Budget
description: Bank of Canada officials discussed delaying a rate cut until they had more details about Prime Minister Mark Carney’s budget and US trade policy.

title: Canada Eyes Joining Eurovision
description: Canada is a long way from Europe, but that isn't stopping it from trying to crack the Eurovision lineup. A surprise note in the nation's recent federal budget revealed that the government and CBC/Radio-Canada are exploring a bid to join the famously over-the-…

title: Ottawa seeking a permanent parliamentary budget officer with 'tact and discretion'
description: Ottawa says it's looking to hire a permanent parliamentary budget officer — someone with "tact and discretion" — just a few months after appointing a critical fiscal watchdog on an interim basis.

title: Government spends $19B on external services, despite vow to trim spending
description: Government records show the federal government spent more than $19 billion on external professional and special services in 2024-25 — an increase of almost $2 billion since last year and of about $8.5 billion since 2020.

title: Canada Budget Watchdog Doubts Carney Can Fulfill Deficit Promise
description: Canada’s budget watchdog is skeptical Prime Minister Mark Carney’s government will fulfill one of its key fiscal pledges.

title: Energy stocks rise on major projects enthusiasm, while U.S. stock markets were mixed
description: TORONTO — Canada’s main stock index finished higher on Friday amid gains in energy stocks following more major projects announcements, while U.S. markets were mixed. Theresa Shutt, chief investment officer at Harbourfront Wealth Management, said gains in the …

title: Is Mark Carney's budget a Progressive Conservative budget?
description: Attempting perhaps to turn a story about his own leadership into a story about whether the media have unfairly focused on Conservative dissent, Pierre Poilievre challenged reporters to pay as much attention to criticism levelled against the federal budget by …

title: Carney Searches for Votes to Pass Budget and Avoid Snap Election
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s government faces a decisive moment on Monday when Canada’s House of Commons votes on a proposed budget that would increase borrowing to spend on the military and infrastructure.

title: Canada to form financial crimes agency to tackle online scams
description: The Government of Canada has announced plans to form the country’s first-ever financial crimes agency in an effort to combat online scams. Announced as part of a broader “Anti-Fraud Strategy,” the government says this agency will “bring together the required …

title: Poilievre calls on Carney to keep federal deficit under $42B in next month's budget
description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre is demanding that Prime Minister Mark Carney cut taxes and keep the federal deficit under $42 billion in the coming budget.

title: Ontario's legislature back for a short session as economic storm clouds loom
description: Ontario’s legislature returns today for what some experts say will be a short, but packed session, as economic storm clouds swirl over the province and questions linger about a multi-billion dollar skills fund.

title: What’s Next for Carney Government After Surviving Budget Vote
description: theepochtimes

title: Why two NDP MPs abstained from the federal budget vote, and what comes next
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s first budget was passed on Monday in the House of Commons by a narrow vote. Interim NDP Leader Don Davies explains why they couldn't back the budget, and what he says the government should do next.

title: How the Conservatives helped pass Carney's budget, avoiding an election
description: Minutes before time ran out on Monday's budget vote, two senior Conservatives swooped into the chamber claiming their electronic voting app wasn't working and declared they wanted to vote against Prime Minister Mark Carney's first budget.

title: MPs pass Carney budget, avoid holiday election
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s minority Liberal government narrowly survived its third confidence vote in as many weeks on Monday, passing the federal budget by a vote of 170-168 and staving off a holiday election.

title: Cost of bureaucracy balloons 80 per cent in 10 years: Public Accounts
description: OTTAWA, ON: The cost of the bureaucracy increased by $6 billion last year, according to newly released numbers in Public Accounts disclosures. The Canadian Taxpayers Federation is calling on Prime Minister Mark Carney to immediately shrink the bureaucracy.“The Public Accounts show the cost of the federal bureaucracy is out of control,” said Franco Terrazzano, CTF Federal Director. “Tinkering around the edges won’t cut it, Carney needs to take urgent action to shrink the bloated federal bureaucracy.”

title: Ex-NHLer Theo Fleury speaks out against Canadian PM Mark Carney's first federal budget: "The Communist takeover of Canada is complete"
description: Former NHLer Theo Fleury has condemned Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney's inaugural federal budget.

title: Canada Avoids Election as Carney’s Budget Narrowly Passes House
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney won a key budget vote by the slimmest of margins in Canada’s Parliament, ensuring the survival of his government.

title: In the news today: MPs to vote on Prime Minister Carney’s budget
description: Here is a roundup of stories from The Canadian Press designed to bring you up to speed… MPs to vote on Prime Minister Mark Carney’s first budget today Members of Parliament will today decide whether to vote in favour of Prime Minister Mark Carney’s budget or send the country back to the polls less than […]
